objects.name: Analytic 0217
objects.description: Detection of SSH/Telnet session hijacking via discrepancies between authentication logs and active session tables. Adversary behavior includes reusing or stealing active PTY sessions, attaching to screen/tmux, or issuing commands without corresponding login events.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve: Commands executed within an SSH session where no matching logon/authentication event exists

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Connections
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Mismatch between recorded user logon and active sessions (e.g., wtmp/utmp entries without corresponding authentication in auth.log)

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Long-lived or hijacked SSH sessions maintained with no active user activity

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Ports for SSH/Telnet/RDP monitored for session hijacking; may vary by environment.
